thread.title: Chinese Super League side Tianjin TEDA make £34million move for Sporting Lisbon striker Bas Dost
thread.title_full: Chinese Super League side Tianjin TEDA make £34million move for Sporting Lisbon striker Bas Dost

title: Chinese Super League side Tianjin TEDA make £34million move for Sporting Lisbon striker Bas Dost

locations.name: stamford bridge saints go east southampton

organizations.name: ink eden hazard is real madrid

text:
counting the dost Chinese Super League side Tianjin TEDA make £34million move for Sporting Lisbon striker Bas Dost 
Prolific Dutch marksman only joined Portuguese side last August but has already scored 17 goals in 18 league games By Fred Nathan Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CHINESE Super League side Tianjin TEDA are lining up a £34million swoop for big Sporting Lisbon striker Bas Dost. 
The Dutch marksman only joined Portuguese side last August from Wolfsburg but has already scored 17 goals in 18 league games this season. Getty Images 3 Bas Dost has been in stunning form for Sporting Lisbon this season 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But TWM report that in the last few hours the mega rich Chinese club have bid for the prolific six foot five forward, top scorer in the Portuguese Primeira Liga. 
Whether the fact that Dost has a contract until 2020 and also has a £50m release clause will deter the side, who have former Chelsea star John Obi Mikel on their books, remains to be seen. Getty Images The ex-Wolfsburg striker is wanted by Tianjin for a whopping £34m fee related stories party time When Barcelona star Romario asked boss Johan Cruyff if he could have time off to attend Rio carnival in 1994 Here Wee go Tottenham give teenage Dutch keeper Nick Weegink a trial with other Premier League clubs interest In Rood health Wayne Rooney could receive an incredible £15MILLION pay-off from Man United if he makes China move ZLAT'S ALL MINE Ibrahimovic in line for huge Man Utd bonus after smashing 20-goal mark this season in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw? Manchester United through and Tottenham hope to join them - all you need to know lof-ty ambitions AC Milan to battle Manchester United for Victor Lindelof following Serie A giants' £622million sale PREM FIXTURES Chelsea look to extend lead at the top of the table to 11 points against Swansea QUICK AS A FLASH Porto 0, Juventus 2: Supersubs Marco Pjaco and Dani Alves both score two minutes apart with their FIRST touches to seal the win BLUE INK Eden Hazard is Real Madrid's top summer target - but Chelsea star drops huge hint he will stay at Stamford Bridge Saints go East Southampton targeted by Far East investors as China's largest investment bank lines up £225million bid THIERRY HENRY Arsene Wenger must see something in his Arsenal players in training that we don’t TV Times Manchester United vs Southampton: What TV channel is the EFL Cup final on and when is it? 
If a move does take place, Sporting would make more than a £25m profit on the star, having only signed him for £8m. 
Bost netted 36 goals in 84 Bundesliga appearances after joining Wolfsburg in 2012 – and scored an impressive 45 goals in 66 games for Eredivisie side Heerenveen between 2010 and 2012. EPA 3 The striker is a towering six foot five inches tall 
The 27-year-old quickly became a sensation in the Portuguese league prompting interest – but Tianjin only have until February 28 to sign him before their transfer window shuts. 
Last summer, then-Sunderland boss Sam Allardyce was keen on 12-cap Dutch international Dost and hoped to land him after the Euros before he landed the England job.
